page.title: 01ACTON AND S.W. LAVENHAM
page.content: The block lies mainly in the Parish of Acton with parts of the parishes of Lavenham Gt Waldingfield and Long Melford to the N.east S.east and N.west respectively. This is a predominantly agricultural area with scattered dwell- ings, mainly farmhouses. In the N.E. lie the outskirts of Lavenham. The terrain is a low plateau with a max. height of 86m to the east sloping grad- ually to 40m in the s.west. Drainage is towards the Chad Brook which runs southward in the west of the block. The block is traversed north-south by a B road. Two minor roads cross from SW to NE to join the B road. Another minor road comes from the west to join the B road in Lavenham village. In general, the climate follows the East Anglian pattern but there are some interesting local variations.
